perturbation.original_text: 1.9  ISA Client shall mean: (i) an entity to which Rubicon provides services pursuant to Section 3, below; and (ii) an entity that ISA has  consulted with before or during the Term regarding the provision of goods or services.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.9 ISA Client shall mean: (i) an entity to which Rubicon provides services pursuant to Section 3, below; and (ii) an entity that ISA has consulted with before or during the Term regarding the provision of goods or services; and (iii) an entity that has entered into a legally binding agreement with ISA.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes entities ISA has consulted with, while the new definition includes the entities that has entered into a legally binding agreement with ISA. This conflict introduces uncertainty as to whether mere consultation is sufficient to classify an entity as an ISA Client, or if a contract is necessary, which affects the obligations and commission structures tied to ISA Clients.

perturbation.original_text: 4.5 Audits. Each Party shall retain the financial records relating to all payments owed and/or paid under this Agreement for a period of six  years from the date such payment obligation arose.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.5 Audits. Each Party shall retain the financial records relating to all payments owed and/or paid under this Agreement for a period of two years from the date such payment obligation arose.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement stated a retention period of six years for financial records, while the modified version reduces this period to two years. This introduces a contradiction regarding the required retention period, potentially leading to disputes over compliance and access to financial data for audits and legal purposes.

perturbation.original_text: 8.4 Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing Party or destroyed  unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement or as otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties. The confidentiality  obligations contained in this Section 8 shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three years.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement, all Confidential Information shall be returned to the disclosing Party or destroyed  unless otherwise specified or permitted elsewhere under this Agreement or as otherwise mutually agreed upon by the Parties. The confidentiality  obligations contained in this Section 8 shall survive termination of this Agreement indefinitely.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement specified a three-year survival period for confidentiality obligations post-termination. The modified version states that these obligations survive indefinitely. This creates a contradiction regarding the duration of confidentiality, affecting the scope and enforceability of these obligations after the agreement ends.
